intro: Connarus punctulatus, commonly known as the spotted connarus, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with distinctive yellowish spots. It produces small, white to pale green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds.
